intro: Pterocereus gaumeri subsp. foetidus, commonly known as the stinking moon cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems and nocturnal blooming habit, producing fragrant, white flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments and has a succulent structure to store water. Its subspecies name, *foetidus*, refers to the strong, unpleasant odor of its flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value despite its distinctive scent.
